titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Alexander Papers
titlestmt.author: by Monika Lehman

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 03:03

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers document the personal and professional life of Michael Alexander, professor, translator, and editor, who focused on Ezra Pound's works and his influence during his career. The collection includes submission drafts for Alexander's book, The Sons of Ezra: British Poets and Ezra Pound; correspondence with writers and colleagues including Ezra Pound, Peter Whigham, and Peter Russell; and publication information for The Sons of Ezra. Also included are papers pertaining to Alexander's role as associate editor at Agenda; Alexander's research files on Pound and his influences; typescripts of Peter Whigham's poetry; and an outline for an edition of Cantullus's "LXIV."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers document the personal and professional life of Michael Alexander, who focused on Ezra Pound's works and influence on other writers during his career. The collection includes submission drafts for Alexander's book, The Sons of Ezra: British Poets and Ezra Pound; correspondence with writers and other colleagues including Ezra Pound, Peter Whigham, and Peter Russell; and publication information for The Sons of Ezra. Also included are papers pertaining to Alexander's role as associate editor at Agenda; Alexander's research files on Pound and his influences; typescripts of Peter Whigham's poetry; and an outline for an English translation by Whigham of Catullus's Epithalamium pelei et Thetidos.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Michael Alexander Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Michael Alexander Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Alexander (1941-), English professor at St. Andrew's College and editor. Alexander was the co-editor of The Sons of Ezra: British Poets and Ezra Pound (Amsterdam, Neth.: Rodopi, 1995) with James McGonigal. Alexander was also an associate editor at Agenda, a literary magazine founded by Ezra Pound and William Cookson in 1959.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: Series I. Correspondence, 1959-2013. Series II. Editorial Work, 1985-2003. Series III. Ezra Pound Related Materials, 1963-2013. Series IV. Books, 1957-1990.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Joan Winterkorn on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund and the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 2016.

controlaccess.title: Agenda (London, England)
controlaccess.subject: Editors -- Great Britain
Poets, English -- 20th Century
controlaccess.corpname: University of St. Andrews. Department of English

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I includes correspondence between Alexander and his colleagues, friends, and relatives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is arranged alphabetically by correspondent. The folder contents are in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains major works edited by Alexander: Agenda magazine and "The Sons of Ezra: British Poets and Ezra Pound."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II is arranged in the way in which it was recieved by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series III is arranged in groups by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains materials about Ezra Pound and Pound scholarship. It also includes information from a conference on Pound and drafts of Peter Whigham's poetry. The conference, the Ezra Pound International Conference, was hosted by the Institute of English Studies and held at the University of London, Senate House in July, 2011.

did.unittitle: Ezra Pound Conference, Whigham correspondence, and Whigham manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains books owned by Michael Alexander. Many of the books are collections of poetry written or edited by his colleagues Peter Russell and Peter Whigham. Some books have dedications; The Worth Record, Summer Term 1962 is annotated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series IV is arranged by title.

did.unittitle: The Blue Winged Bee by Peter Whigham
The Poems of Meleager edited by Peter Jay
Things Common, Properly: Selected Poems 1942-1980 by Peter Whigham
Fragments of a Life by Moelwyn Merchant
The Marriage Rite by Peter Whigham and Denis Groacher
